title: Another Solution to tank meta: Buff Zeke's Herald
body:
If enemy is stacking thornmail solution buy 1 zeke herald on your team. 
Kind of like how aegis and abysal cancel each other out same could be for thornmail zeke's. 
Zeke's passive is strong but the item iself is meh for the person using it. 
I propose removing the extra damage on its aura and redirect/focus the stats toward making the item more attractive for the character using it.

> Stats	
> **+300 health**
> +20% cooldown reduction
> **+25 ad**
> **+5% life steal**
> Aura	UNIQUE: ~~Nearby allied champions gain +20 attack damage and~~  **+10% life steal. (1100 Range)**

Since bruiser/fighters champions cant offer their adc as much peel as well as tanks, at least they could get's zeke as a form of assistance. 
Also as a top laner getting zeke you comprimise your lane dominance top lane considerably. This buff would keep your threat level high enough that the enemy might think twice before rivaling you. 

supports have enough support items to choose from already and even if they were to get zeke it would be late into the game and preferable after they got ice born gauntlet. 
Most other support items synergize with support genre more. 
Even for the support champion that might run iceborngauntlet into zeke the recommended changes wouldn't compromise it. 



or
What if you zeke did not have an aura but instead was like nunu's blood boil. instead of being an aura you apply it to an ally. you could have 2 charges kind of like smite and use it on up to two champions. 1 charge every 30 seconds. lasts 6 seconds.

replies.body:
Vampiric Scepter builds into enough stuff. How about...

Brutalizer + Kindlegem

350 Health
20% CDR
30 Attack Damage

Unique AURA: Aura of Shattering: Reduces Armor of nearby enemies by 20.

It'll be good on both melee, tanky supports, and AD Casters who favor the flat pen of Brutalizer over the new Black Cleaver.
That is a whole hell of a lot of stats we don't like bruisers having.

Kindlegem builds into enough stuff. How about...

{{item:3050}} 


> {{item:3134}} Brutalizer + {{item:1053}} Vampiric Scepter
> 
> Stats:
> 
> 10% CDR
> 25 Attack Damage
> 
> Aura	 UNIQUE: Nearby allied champions gain +10 attack damage, +10 Armor Penetration and +10% life steal. (1100 Range)

It'll be good on both melee, tanky supports, and AD Casters who favor the flat pen of Brutalizer over the new Black Cleaver.

Since bruiser/fighters champions cant offer their adc as much peel as well as tanks, at least they could get's zeke as a form of assistance.
Also as a top laner getting zeke you comprimise your lane dominance top lane considerably. This buff would keep your threat level high enough that the enemy might think twice before rivaling you.

Personally, I only think zeke's need an HP increase(or a massive cost decrease). The aura isn't that great by the time you can finish the item, but it's still there. It would be a fantastic 20% CDR support item, but the hp is way too low to justify getting it over so many other items.

I think Zeke's is fine as it is really. Currently, if Zeke is affecting all 5 champions with it's aura, it's the most cost effective item in the game (It's also still cost effective even when you're alone). It's really good if you have 3 champions on your team that are AD based too.

Then again, I get it on supports instead of bruisers/tanks so maybe that's why I am getting more use out of it.

> [{quoted}](name=GuiltyGecko,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=x0mXfN8F,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-04-19T17:32:38.125+0000)
>
> I think Zeke's is fine as it is really. Currently, if Zeke is affecting all 5 champions with it's aura, it's the most cost effective item in the game (It's also still cost effective even when you're alone). It's really good if you have 3 champions on your team that are AD based too.
> 
> Then again, I get it on supports instead of bruisers/tanks so maybe that's why I am getting more use out of it.

I wouldn't build it on anything but a support, simply because the hp is too low and only because it comes with 20% cdr. It may be cost effective when you have more AD champs than AP, but that's also only true if they are AA focused champs. The biggest issue I have is that there's aren't many other support items that give CDR and tanky stats for champs like Leona. They are there, but they are lackluster. If zeke's could have a tweak, it would be the perfect item. Either a cost reduction, or an HP increase. Counter this by removing the AD bonus or something. Hell, I'd even take it with 10% cdr if the HP was higher.

250 hp just doesn't justify rushing it over other items more useful or more tanky. The aura isn't very helpful if you're dead or if you're gimping yourself as a support by not getting something else.

Erm, Tank meta doesn't need "fixing".

Zeke's is already a strong item (it is just a lot of invisible power that leaves it *incredibly* underrated) and the fact that tank meta gets countered by double AD comps which are in turn strengthened by Zeke's substantially already means it doesn't need buffs. The issue it has is that it has a reputation for not being great, and most people don't think about how valuable it is even in a normal match if your ADC is fed.
Thats not a buff but a nerf.
I like this meta, I honestly think it's the healthiest we've had in a long time

what if i told you this wouldn't change the meta. people can already buy zeke and do even on characters like jarvan, olaf... they'll just have a bit more to go on/contribute with as an individual with zeke. 
I think what is the main factor that will always keep zeke's herald gated from being too strong is its maximum amount of stats/price point. 
By keeping it as a 2450 gold item you're already setting yourself back a bit/sacrificing total potential 6 item worth of stats by getting it. 
you could have randuins omen or a hydra or a black cleaver instead.

its true: The cdr (and maybe the hp) is really what makes it identified as a support item. I just think it would shine more if it was geared more towards fighters.  itll still be somewhat viable on supports but mostly those who themselves can derive something out of it. 

the item currently is designed such that if you derived nothing from it its still good. which seems kind of counter intuitive. 
for those champions who do  buy it to get maximum use out of the lifesteal,  they have other ways of getting cdr and hp elsewhere.

at end of the day neither (supports nor figthers) really buy it since it doesn't do as good a job of comprehensively meeting their individual and team oriented needs.
I don't think Riot wants to buff Auras - they are on a mission to remove invisible power.
